summary: This is a brief email from an unknown sender to Alex Acosta and others, forwarding a one-line message received from Jack Goldberger, Epstein's counsel, stating he is out of the office and will respond to a fax by the next day.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Recipient of the email, referenced by his official email address. He was the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida at the time.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: The attorney for Jeffrey Epstein who sent a brief message stating he was out of the office and would respond to a fax the following day.

connections.description: Goldberger, as Epstein's counsel, is communicating with Acosta, the U.S. Attorney, regarding a fax.

events.title: Fax from U.S. Attorney's Office to Epstein's counsel
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's office sent a fax to Jack Goldberger, Epstein's attorney, on this date.

keyFacts: This email documents direct communication between the U.S. Attorney's office (led by Alex Acosta) and Jeffrey Epstein's defense counsel (Jack Goldberger) in July 2008.
The communication concerns a fax sent by the prosecution to the defense on July 8, 2008, to which Goldberger promises a response.
The email is a forward, indicating internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's office regarding the Epstein case.
